title: glitter
body:
A small, shiny, and reflective particle often used to decorate the object or subject to create a sparkle reflection (or "glittery").

This tag is for when glitter is featured in the image, for a stray dot of light, use [[sparkle]] instead. If there are several of them, tag [[light particles]] instead.

title: protagonist_(lost_property_control_organization)
body:
The technically unnamed (see Post #8567548 and Post #6901257), [[amnesia|amnesiac]] protagonist of [[Samidare (Hoshi)]]'s [[horror (theme)|]] [[video game|game]] concept series, [[Lost Property Control Organization (samidare)|]]. She has [[short hair|short]], [[black hair]], [[aqua eyes]], and wears a pair of thin, [[white ribbon]]s [[hair ribbon|in her hair]] on both sides of her head. Her hairstyle can be changed during character creation and gameplay. She wears a [[school uniform]] while working undercover.

Images that are chronologically early in the series depict her using a [[rust|rusty]] [[lead pipe|pipe]] for a weapon, while images from further down the timeline have her using a [[baseball bat]] wrapped in [[barbed wire]], a [[handgun]], [[spiked knuckles|spiked]] [[brass knuckles]], a [[stun gun]], a trick [[umbrella]], a [[golf club]], a [[sledgehammer]], [[bug spray]], or a [[harpoon]], depicting [[gameplay mechanics|upgrades]] or sidegrades that a player would make to their gear as they progress.

She is accompanied by a [[floating|hovering]] [[drone]], [[T-6407j (samidare)|]], and wears a [[hooded coat]] or [[hooded jacket|jacket]] while on missions.

Her gender is decided during character creation, with one possible male version being shown here.
* !post #9055767

[spoiler]In one ending of the game, she becomes Lost Property 774 after defeating [[lost property 004 (samidare)|Lost Property 004]].[/spoiler]

title: alternate_language
body:
An image that has been hard-translated to another language (usually English) by the artist themselves, or by someone authorized by the artist (the company officially publishing a localization, a translator with the permission of the artist, etc).

In most cases the artist posts the translated version alongside the original version. In some cases the official translation may be poor quality, even though it was sanctioned by the artist.

This is different from [[hard-translated]], which is generally done by [[third-party_edit|third parties]].

title: pearl_harbor
body:
[b]Pearl Harbor[/b] is a natural harbor and [[United States Navy]] base on the [[Hawaii]]an island of Oahu. It was the site of "the 7 December 1941 attack":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attack_on_Pearl_Harbor by [[Japan]]ese naval and air forces that brought the [[United States]] into [[World War II]].

h4.See also

* [[USS Arizona Memorial]]
* Wikipedia article: "Pearl Harbor":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pearl_Harbor and "Attack on Pearl Harbor":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attack_on_Pearl_Harbor

title: sails_(sonic)
body:
An alternate universe variant of [[Tails (Sonic)|]] who appears in the animated series [i][[Sonic Prime]][/i]. In this series, the multiverse is fractured, leading to the creation of various alternate realities. Sails Tails is from the "No Place" dimension, a pirate-themed reality. In this world, he is a member of [[Knuckles the Dread]]'s pirate crew aboard the Angel's Voyage.

Physically, Sails Tails resembles the original Tails, being an anthropomorphic fox with two tails. However, he sports a pirate-themed outfit, including brown gloves and boots, a white bandanna with blue stripes over his right ear, a brown vest, and a brown belt equipped with a mechanical arm, reflecting his role as a pirate.

title: tails_(sonic)
body:
[b]Miles "Tails" Prower[/b] is [[Sonic the Hedgehog]]'s orange fox sidekick and long time friend. His name is a pun on "miles per hour", but he prefers to go by his nickname "Tails". 

He has two tails that he uses for flying like a helicopter, and is just as smart as [[Dr. Eggman]] when it comes to robotics. He's able to build and fly his own planes like the Tornado.

His voice actors are Hayashi Kazuki (1998-1999), Murata Atsuki (2000-2001), and [[Hirohashi Ryou]] (since 2003) in Japanese.

Voiced by Connor Bringas, Corey Bringas, Amy Palent, [[Kate Higgins]], and Colleen Villard in English. 

Among the cast of Sonic characters, Tails has received the most voice changes.

title: fafnir_(mobile_suit)
body:
A fictional variable geometry giant manned robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Gundam Walpurgis]].

[b]MSZ-009H Fafnir[/b]

A protype transformable [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by the [[Earth Federation]] that is equipped with the same Grimoire System seen on the AGX-11 [[Over.on]] and AMX-114 [[demeter_(mobile_suit)|Demeter]]. 

It is designed to resemble the ORX-005 [[Gaplant]] and also comes equipped with the F.A.V.N.R system and the Blue Grimoire to increase performance of the machine and pilot.

title: the_looney_tunes_show
body: The Looney Tunes Show is an American animated sitcom produced by Warner Bros. Animation, and aired on [[Cartoon Network]] for two seasons from May 3, 2011, to November 2, 2013. The series featured characters from the [[Looney Tunes]] and Merrie Melodies theatrical cartoon shorts in a sitcom format with [[Bugs Bunny]] and [[Daffy Duck]], who live a suburban life together within a neighborhood of fellow cartoon neighbors, dealing with various issues in their own way. Many episodes also include a musical short under the Merrie Melodies name, and the first season also includes computer-animated shorts involving new antics between [[Wile E Coyote]] and the [[Road Runner (looney tunes)|]].
other_names: ルーニー・テューンズ・ショー

title: fear_&_hunger_1
body:
An indie survival horror dungeon-crawler video game with RPG elements created by Miro Haverinen.

The player is tasked with guiding one of four protagonists through a mysterious dungeon located in the fantasy kingdom of Rondon. Although each protagonist arrives for different reasons, they will all be forced to face the turmoil and darkness of the depths to accomplish those goals.

The game is notorious for both its difficulty and extremely graphic violence and occasional graphic sexual violence.

It has a direct sequel in [[Fear & Hunger 2: Termina]], set 300 years after the events of Fear & Hunger.

h4. Party Members

title: haman_karn
body:
Antagonist female character from [i][[Zeta Gundam]][/i] and [i][[Gundam ZZ]][/i]. An intelligent, calculating, cold, cruel and evil beautiful woman, she is the regent to [[Mineva Lao Zabi]] and de facto leader of [[Neo Zeon]]. 

Haman pilots the [[mobile suit]]s [[Gaza-C]] and the [[Qubeley]]. [spoilers]A powerful Newtype, Haman Karn dies during a pivotal [[space]] [[battle]] duel against [[Judau Ashta]] in his [[ZZ Gundam]] at the end of Gundam ZZ.[/spoilers]

She is also featured heavily in [[Char's Deleted Affair]] as a teenager, and an [[office lady]] AU version of her is the protagonist of [[Arasa OL Haman-sama]].

Haman's peculiar hairstyle was based on "this photo":https://www.pinterest.com/pin/37788084359430218/.

title: egg_hammer
body:
One of Dr. Eggman’s robotic creations—a heavy, [[hammer]]-wielding Badnik that appears in several instalments of the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]].

Compared to the smaller [[Egg Pawn]], an Egg Hammer is much larger, heavily armored, and equipped with a massive, spike-adorned hammer. These Badniks are characterized by their imposing size and brute strength—even though they move slowly.

Their design typically includes a rounded, armored torso with distinctive color schemes (often incorporating purples, reds, grays, and blacks) along with large hands and feet to better handle their weapon.

title: fading
body:
When a character is gradually vanishing into nothingness. Typically rendered as the person being partially [[transparent]] or parts of the body disappearing from one end to the other. This tag may require context and be subjective.

* Not to be confused with [[projected inset]], when a character is inset at a lower opacity for dramatic or comedic effect.

* Not to be confused with [[zoom layer]], where an image has a semi-transparent, upscaled version in the background.

If a person seems to be merely drawn as translucent, rather than actually being so (such as for the sake of showing something behind them), then tag as [[x-ray]] instead.

* Consider using [[dissolving]] instead if a character is becoming incorporated into a [[liquid]] or [[smoke]].

h4. Examples

* !post #1088179
* !post #1085038

h4. See Also

* [[invisible]]
* [[dissolving]]
* [[disintegration]]
* [[melting]]

title: colt_m1877
body:
The Colt Model 1877 was a double-action [[revolver]] with very similar dimensions to the more famous [[Colt Single Action Army]], though can be visually distinguished by its larger trigger guard and curved handle. It was a favored weapon of figures such as Billy the Kid, John Wesley Hardin, and John Henry "Doc" Holliday.

Despite users of such pedigree, the Model 1877's double-action system was extremely delicate and frequently broke, turning the gun into a single-action where the hammer and trigger had to be manually operated. Much like the SAA, the Model 1877 was never made capable of using smokeless gunpowder, and late in its life had to carry large warnings to use black gunpowder only.

In anime, the Model 1877 is most commonly seen used by [[Billy the Kid (fate)|]] in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

She also trades her usual crown for a [[yellow bow|yellow]] [[hair bow]] and has on a pair of [[orange footwear|orange]] [[rubber boots]]. Often seen with a [[rake]].

title: white_army
body:
The [b]Russian White Army[/b] (also known as the White Guard or White Movement) refers to a loose confederation of anti-Bolshevik forces that fought against the [[soviet army|Red Army]] during the [[Russian Civil War]] (1917–1923). Emerging after the [[October Revolution]], the White Army was composed of monarchists, conservatives, liberals, and other factions united by their opposition to the Bolsheviks. Unlike their unified opponents, the Whites lacked a single cohesive ideology or leadership, which contributed to their eventual defeat.

The White Movement began forming in 1917 as resistance to the Bolshevik seizure of power. Key leaders included Admiral [[Alexander Kolchak]], General [[Anton Denikin]], and General [[Pyotr Wrangel]]. Operating across vast regions like Siberia, South Russia, and the Far East, the Whites received support from foreign powers such as the Allied Intervention forces (e.g., Britain, France, and the United States). Despite early successes, internal divisions, corruption, and lack of popular support led to their collapse by 1923.

h4. Symbolism

The term "White" contrasts with the "Red" of the Bolsheviks, drawing from historical Russian symbolism where white represented purity and loyalty to the Tsar. The Whites often used the double-headed eagle and the tricolor flag (white, blue, red) of the Russian Empire as their emblems.

h4. See also

* [[Soviet Army|Red Army]]
* [[Imperial Russian Army]]
* [[Russian Empire]]

title: quackity
body:
Mexican streamer and Youtuber. These days, streams in both Spanish and English and makes mostly [[Minecraft YouTube|Minecraft]] content. Has played characters on the [[Dream SMP]] and [[Karmaland]]; founded and plays on the [[Quackity SMP]].

In Dream SMP, he was the vice president of Manberg under [[Jschlatt]]'s rule, with the two being entangled in a toxic romantic relationship. He would later go on to get engaged to [[Karl Jacobs]] and [[Sapnap]], but would become estranged from them and instead focus his attention on his new casino nation, Las Nevadas, recruiting various members for the new faction and training [[Slimecicle]] as his successor.

h4. Appearance
Quackity is usually drawn as a man with [[black hair]] who wears a blue [[beanie]]. While his Minecraft skins have a pale skintone, fanart often depicts him with a slightly darker skintone.

h5. Skins

title: no_to_ai_generated_images_(alexander_nanitchkov)
body:
Posts referencing a certain viral image featuring a [[no symbol]] over the word AI, with a caption reading "No to AI generated images" as a statement against [[AI-generated]] images. The logo was originally designed by [[Alexander Nanitchkov]], though the original upload has since been removed from his account.

The image was posted en masse to ArtStation, [[DeviantArt]], and [[Pixiv]] in protest of those sites' announcements that they would not ban [[AI-generated]] art. The image later spread to [[Lofter]], after the site announced they would be launching an image generation feature.

h4. Original Version
* !asset #7318081

h4. See also

title: hanfu
body:
Historical styles of clothing worn by the Han Chinese. Most styles have a “y” shape collar, but there are also styles with a rounded collar.

There are several styles that are at times mistaken for kimono (most notably [[ruqun]]). You can typically distinguish between them based on the hairstyle and headwear. Males' hair may be pulled back into a simple ponytail or bun or held by a coronet. Emperors or princes may wear [[mian guan]]. If nothing else, [[huadian]] (forehead mark), or the [[tuanshan|circular fan]] is an easy distinguishing mark. 

Hanfu differs from [[Qing dynasty|Qing]] era clothing. Hanfu specifically refers to clothing worn during dynasties wherein the ruling class was made up of the majority Chinese ethnic group, the Han. The Qing Dynasty was ruled by the [[Manchu clothes|Manchu]] ethnic minority. The frog button and mandarin collar style clothes, often simply refered to as Chinese clothes, are not Hanfu, as they are not Han clothing, but in fact Manchu. This goes too for other ethnic minority clothing in china, such as [[Miao clothes]] or [[Uygur clothes]]. These fall under the umbrella of [[Chinese clothes]], along with hanfu. 

h4. Types

title: fiona_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Fiona[/b] (フリーダ [i]furida[/i]; [b]Frida[/b]) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn]].

She is the daughter of Lanvega, who was one of Daein's Great Four Riders. She is the ruler of the independent Marado territory in Daein. At first, she sides with the Begnion Occupational Army, but later joins the Daein Liberation Army after seeing what kind of monstrous acts the Occupation Army does to her people. After the last battle, because she is the lady of Marado, she watched over her beloved people and would protect them until the autumn of her years.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Lance Knight

title: super_radiant_peach
body:
The final transformation in [i][[Princess Peach: Showtime!]][/i], given to [[Princess Peach|Peach]] by the power of nearby [[theet_(peach)|Theets]] after [[Grape_(peach)|]] destroys the Sparkle Theater. 

She retains the large crystallized crown, sun-like brooch, and the [[white dress|white]] & [[blue dress|blue]] colors of the [[Radiant Peach]] dress. But instead this dress is similar to [[Rosalina]]'s, losing the puffy short sleeves for [[long sleeves|long]] and [[wide sleeves]]. And while this dress retains the expelling of a [[sparkle]]-like pattern from underneath, the dress itself is also covered with [[print_dress|prints]] of this [[sparkle_print|same pattern]]. 

Known as [b]Super Prism Peach[/b] in Japanese.

title: galette_(food)
body:
A term to designate various types of flat round or freeform crusty cakes. It can refer to:
* [b]Fruit galette:[/b] A single crust, free-form [[pie]] with the crust folded partway over the top of the fruit filling. 
* [b]Breton galette:[/b] A [[crepe]]-like dishes in the form of a folded square, originated from Brittany. They are comparatively larger as they are commonly eaten as a main course, and usually filled with savoury ingredients such as [[cheese]], [[egg]] and [[ham]]. 
* [b][[Galette des rois (food)|]][/b]

title: cocoa_bean
body:
Cocoa beans, also known as cacao beans, are the dried and fully fermented [[seed]]s of the Theobroma [[cacao fruit]], native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. They resemble [[coffee beans]] but without the signature slit. 

These beans are the primary ingredient used in the production of [[chocolate]], [[cocoa powder]], and cocoa butter.

title: kamek
body:
[i][[mario_(series)|Mario]][/i] character. 

A [[Magikoopa]] closely associated with [[Bowser]]. He often serves as Bowser's advisor, and has doubled as his caretaker throughout the [i][[super_mario_world_2:_yoshi's_island |Yoshi's Island]][/i] series. He has the ability to make enemies grow.

Not to be confused for the Japanese term for the Magikoopa race. 

Since Kamek and Magikoopas have the exact same design, contextual clues are used to determine one or the other. The image most likely has Kamek if:

** The setting is within the [[Yoshi]] franchise or in the past (such as the main characters are their baby counterparts).
** A [u]singular[/u] [[blue_robe|blue-robed]] Magikoopa that is shown to be closely associated with Bowser, [[Bowser Jr.]] or the [[Koopalings]]
** Has the ability to make characters grow in size
** Rides a broomstick (though some generic Magikoopa does this too)

h4. Official Art
* !post #6077110

h4. See also
* [[Kamella]]
* [[Kammy Koopa]]
* [[Princess Kamek]] ([[Super Crown]]ed)

body:

In this form he is mostly seen antagonizing the [[Yoshi|Yoshis]]. [[Kamek]] is seemingly his caretaker and attempts to appease all of his demanding needs.

[b]Not to be confused with [[Bowser Jr.]][/b] Since the release of [i][[Mario & Luigi: Partners in Time]][/i], the designs of Baby Bowser and Bowser Jr. have become almost identical. The only major difference is in the [[white bandana]] that is worn by Bowser Jr., as either Baby Bowser does not have one or his is just plainly white without the drawing of the mouth and teeth.

title: acca_howler
body:
Acca Howler (アッカ・ハウラー, Akka Haurā) is currently the main antagonist of the ninth part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[The JOJOLands]].
Howler is a man with an athletic build. He has [[medium hair]] that is tied back. His hair is voluminous at the top styled in a jelly roll or elephant trunk, albeit with the front gap similar to a heart shape rather than a circle. Howler's beard looks like rectangular strips with gaps in between, going from the sides of his ears to his chin. The top strips of the beard are longer and angled toward his eyes.

He wears a light short sleeve shirt with notch collars, slightly exposing his upper chest. The shirt has a thick dark outline running down vertically from his collars to above the edge of his shirt, with the lines connecting horizontally at the back. His sleeves also have a dark line going across above the edge. He pairs the shirt with light shorts that have checkered hems.
Below his clothes, Howler wears a mesh bodysuit that is dark and semi-transparent with several circular holes. It has long sleeves and covers his arms and legs.
In addition, Howler wears a choker on his neck made of several "H"-shaped emblems, has an "h" emblem shaped like a wolf from his company's logo embedded on his shirt near his abdomen, dark wristbands

title: tomato_(sword)
body: [[Koseki Bijou]]'s dark [[katana]], introduced with her [[koseki bijou (casual)|third costume]]. Its blade is made of the same purple gemstone as her [[chest jewel]] (and, this costume [[cracked skin|implies]], the rest of her body under her human-appearing skin), and the guard and pommel are crystals of the same gem. Its name is a play on [[yamato (sword)|Yamato]], [[vergil (devil may cry)|Vergil]]'s sword from the [i][[devil may cry (series)|Devil May Cry]][/i] series, and is (usually) pronounced "to-[i]mah[/i]-to".

title: porunga
body:
[b]Porunga[/b] is a powerful entity first debuted in [[Dragon Ball Z]]. He is the dragon god and the [[Namek]]ian equivalent of [[Shenron (dragon ball)|]]. He can be summoned via the Namekian [[Dragon Ball (object)|]]s, which are visually identical to the earth counterpart except being significantly larger in size. He appeared as a [[muscular]] [[dragon boy|humanoid dragon]] with [[red eyes]] and [[green skin]].

Porunga is considerably more powerful than Shenron, as he doesn't share certain limitations that Shenron has (such as asking for the same wishes in separate occasions). When being summoned, he is capable of granting three wishes. However, as a safety measure against evildoers, the wish can only be granted when it is wished in Namekian language.

She wears a [[white bikini]] with decorative [[gold chain]]s serving both as [[necklace]] and a sort of underbust from which hangs a black [[tassel]], a white [[cape]], and what seems to be a white [[sarong]] integrated to the top itself; white [[hair flower]]s forming a [[circlet]], and white [[sandals]].

Likely to include her "weapon" in the game, a set of percusors (one per hand) that vaguely resemble palm trees with purple foliage. Extremely likely to see her along with [[Female byleth (summer) (fire emblem)|Summer Byleth]], the main character of the Duo Unit she's part of - Summer Rhea isn't her own unit in-game.

Note that it's possible (especially for older artwork), to depict Rhea in a swimsuit without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

body:
A pair of Giants of Light from [[Ultraman Tiga (series)|]], who appear alongside the enstatued [[Ultraman Tiga]] at the start of the series as statues. In the process of Tiga's resurrection, the kaiju [[Golza]] and [[Melba (ultra series)|]] would intrude and destroy the pair of the statues. With the exception of the Dark Horse comics of the series, these two would receive little-to-no acknowledgement as characters, and are often referred to as just "Tiga's companions" in English circles.

In some fan circles, it is believed that Tiga's Power and Sky Type were granted to him thanks to these two, and, following Tiga's naming scheme, the single-horned Ultra and the multipointed Ultra are nicknamed Satu and Dua, respectively based on the Malaysian/Indonesian word for "one" and "two".

h4. External links

* "Ultraman Wiki: Tiga's companions":[https://ultra.fandom.com/wiki/Tiga's_companions]

title: chief_of_ultraseven
body:
A character from [[Ultraseven (series)|]]. His appearance is almost identical to [[Ultraseven]]'s. Famously forgotten by Tsuburaya after his appearance, and never being developed into an actual character like his predecessor in [[Zoffy (ultra series)|]]. The last time the character was referenced in-universe was during Tsuburaya's 2010 [[April Fools]]' Day, where on Tsubutter (円谷ッター), Seven remarked that he had been contacted by someone implied to be the Chief.
 
In "Kazumine Daiji":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%80%E5%B3%B0%E5%A4%A7%E4%BA%8C]'s manga adaptation (and a 2007 short spin-off manga by him), the Chief has a larger and pointier Eye Slugger than Seven's, giving him a mohawk look, and the toy of that design gave him blue eyes as opposed to yellow eyes, to distinguish him from Seven. Before the Chief officially received his name around the time of the "Third Monster Boom":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E7%AC%AC%E4%B8%89%E6%AC%A1%E6%80%AA%E7%8D%A3%E3%83%96%E3%83%BC%E3%83%A0] ([[The Ultraman (anime)|]] and [[Ultraman 80 (series)|]]), he was known as Big Seven (ビックセブン), and due to having similar-meaning names, some fans speculated that Dai Seven (大セブン) from "Tetsuji Kataoka":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%8B%E3%81%9F%E3%81%8A%E3%81%8B%E5%BE%B9%E6%B2%BB]'s manga [i]Ultraseven Monogatari[/i] was the same character as the Chief. Some fans also like to joke he was the actual protagonist of [[Ultra Fight]]'s newly-made fight scenes.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8315160

h4. External links

* Ultraman Wiki: "Chief of Ultraman":https://ultra.fandom.com/wiki/Chief_of_Ultraseven

title: maria_(hayate_no_gotoku!)
body:
Second female main character of [[Hayate no Gotoku!]]

[[Sanzen'in Nagi]]'s seventeen-year-old personal maid and colleague to her butler [[Ayasaki Hayate]]. Maria is a prodigy who graduated from Hayate and Nagi's school four years prior, and also acts as Nagi's mother figure. While caring and insightful (being aware of Nagi's one-sided affection for Hayate), she is deathly afraid of cockroaches and is extremely defensive about her age (itself ambiguous, as she was originally an orphan found as an infant next to a statue of the Virgin Mary, after whom she was named).
other_names: マリア(ハヤテのごとく!)

title: snow_(mahoutsukai_no_yakusoku)
body:
[[mahoutsukai_no_yakusoku|Mahoyaku]] character.

Snow (スノウ) is a wizard that resides within the Northern Country. He is the twin brother of [[White (mahoutsukai no yakusoku)|]]. He is known to usually take on the appearance of a child, but he can also change his appearance to resemble that of an adult. He is rumored to be alive for thousands of years. Thoughtful and majestic, but sometimes mischievous.

Japanese CV: Shintaro Asanuma

h4. Appearance

* [b]Hair:[/b] [[black_hair]]
* [b]Eyes:[/b] [[yellow_eyes]]

Hint: A notable difference between the twins is that Snow's hair goes down his neck. White's hair, on the other hand, is shorter in the back.
other_names: スノウ(魔法使いの約束)

title: owl_ears
body:
Tufts of feathers on the top of the head of some species of owl that resemble ears. They are not the owl's actual ears, which are located on the side of their faces, adjacent to their eyes.

On Danbooru, this refers to characters who have these tufts (most notably owl-based characters from [[Kemono Friends]]) or wear accessories resembling them.

title: large_hands
body:
Hands that are larger than normal. More specifically, the hands tend to be as big as the head, or slightly bigger.  This does not take into account [[perspective]] or [[foreshortening]].

Having hands larger than normal is generally considered to be a masculine trait that some find attractive, so much so it has become a trope in the [[yaoi]] genre, often called "Yaoi hands". However, large hands can be a character design choice as well, especially as a way to imply that the character isn't completely "human". Since this design choice is not very common, the hand sizes for such characters tend to be more variable, especially in fan art.

Not to be confused with [[oversized forearms]].

h4. Examples

* !post #6443268: [[Franky (one piece)|]] ([[One Piece]]) 
* !post #7005666: [[Ashiya Douman (fate)|]][br]([[Fate/Grand Order]]) 
* !post #4253264: [[Mountain (arknights)|]] ([[Arknights]])

h4. See also

* [[hand size difference]]
* [[small hands]]
* [[large feet]]

title: hev_suit
body:
[b]H[/b]azardous [b]E[/b]n[b]v[/b]ironment suit

The suit that [[Gordon Freeman]] and other trained [[Black Mesa Science Team]] personnel wear during specific tests. It is a full body orange and black/grey armor, with the [[lambda symbol|lambda letter]] (λ) stamped on it.

Its helmet looks like those of hazmat suits, but it is seldom used by player characters in story. It can be seen during Deathmatches by players using the model, and [spoiler]on dead scientists in Xen.[/spoiler]

It's one of the icons of [[Half-Life (series)|]] and the whole franchise along with the [[crowbar]].

h4. See also
* [[hazmat suit]]
* [[tag group:attire]]

h4. External links
* Combine Overwiki: "Hazardous Environment Suit":https://combineoverwiki.net/wiki/Hazardous_Environment_Suit

title: lambda_symbol
body:
Eleventh letter of the Greek alphabet, and precursor to both the Latin letter L and the Cyrillic letter El (Л).
The lowercase variant (λ) is also a recurring symbol of the [[Half-Life (series)|]] franchise, typically associated with [[Gordon Freeman]], Black Mesa and the rebellion against the Combine in [[Half-Life 2]].
h4. External links
"Wikipedia: Lambda":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lambda]

[quote]Just a normal day at Chaldea— Or so you thought, but this is... The world of "Journey to the West"?!

title: getter_robo_(classic)
body:
The original [[Getter Robo]] manga and anime series, created by [[Ishikawa Ken (character)|]] and [[Nagai Gou (artist)|]]. Both the anime and manga premiered in April 1974 and ran until August 1975. 

Despite running alongside each other, the manga and anime are vastly different. The anime features a more family friendly episodic format, while the manga tells a continuous story and features more graphic violence.

title: getter_robo_arc
body:
The fifth part of the [[Getter Robo]] saga. It was the last part of the series written by creator [[Ishikawa Ken (character)|]], and did not receive a definitive ending due to his untimely passing during the series' run. 

An anime adaptation aired in 2021.

title: doraemon
body:
[b]Doraemon[/b] is a Japanese manga series from 1969 written and illustrated by [[fujiko f fujio (character)|Fujiko F. Fujio]], which later became an anime series and later the most successful anime franchise of all time, spawned over 40 movies and a broad range of merchandises. 

The series is about a robotic cat named [[Doraemon (character)|]], who travels back in time from the 22nd century to aid a pre-teen boy [[Nobi Nobita]] and alter his family's doomed life in the future.

title: tp_bon
body:
T・P Bon, pronounced as [b]Time Patrol Bon[/b], is a [[science fiction]] manga series by [[fujiko f fujio (character)|Fujiko·F·Fujio]]. It was adapted into a 90 minute anime special in 1989.

Unlike several organizations with the same name in other science fictions, the Time Patrol in this series is not a time police but a kind of rescue team. They use [[hover bike]]-style time machines and short-term memory erasing devices.

title: fujiko_f_fujio_(character)
body:
[b]Fujiko F. Fujio[/b] was a pseudonym for [b]Fujimoto Hiroshi[/b] (藤本 弘) (1933-1996), a legendary and influrential manga artist.

Originally he partnered with his long time friend and fellow manga artist Abiko Motoo (安孫子 素雄) with the duo working under the name Fujiko Fujio (藤子不二雄). The duo dissolved their partnership in 1982 due to creative differences and Fujimoto's declining health prompting the duo to settle on their copyright issue, they later published their own works with [b]F[/b]ujimoto as Fujiko [b]F.[/b] Fujio and [b]A[/b]biko as Fujiko Fujio [b]A[/b]. 

He is best known for [i][[Doraemon]][/i] (initially published under Fujiko Fujio, but it was solely written by Fujimoto from the beginning).

In several commentaries and [[artist self-insert]], Fujiko F. Fujio often depicted himself with a [[smoking pipe]] and wearing a [[beret]]. As such, this tag covers both the "avatar" he used in his works as well as posts that depict Fujimoto himself.

h4. See also
* [[Fujiko F Fujio (copyright)]] - reference lists of works done by Fujiko F. Fujio and Fujiko Fujio A
* [[Fujiko F Fujio (style)]]

title: chocolate_bird_(meme)
body:
[b]Chocolate Bird[/b] refers to a scene in the 2011 movie [[Jack and Jill (movie)|]] where a CGI [[cockatoo]] walks into and drinks from a [[chocolate fountain]]. Gained notoriety when screenshots and GIFs of the scene were posted on [[Tumblr]] without context, leading many to believe it was depicting a real bird.

Associated with the phrase "Listen here, cumslut", which one Tumblr user said towards another in a popular reblog chain.

title: kamen_rider_2_(shin)
body:
h6. Batta Augment 02, Ichimonji Hayato.

A former freelance photographer, Hayato was augmented by the organization SHOCKER into a prana-using cyborg. Possessing the ability to transform into his combat mode without the need for speed, he is considered superior to the original Batta Augment, [[kamen rider 1 (shin) |01]].

He derives his happiness from freedom.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7896292: Coat removed, with [[kamen rider 1 (shin)|No. 1]] and [[Midorikawa Ruriko|Ruriko]]
* !post #6933973: Coat on, with [[kamen rider 1 (shin)|No. 1]]

title: kamen_rider_1_(shin)
body:
h6. Batta Augment 01, Takeshi Hongo. 

The son of a fallen police officer, Takeshi Hongo was kidnapped and heavily augmented by the insidious organization SHOCKER as an agent to further their goals of human happiness. Freed by Dr. Hiroshi Midorikawa and his daughter Ruriko, he is tasked with protecting both her and humanity from SHOCKER's misguided ends. He is equipped with a Prana condensing belt, the custom Cyclone motorbike and his augmentations provide superior strength, speed, and agility compared to a normal human.

He derives his happiness from kindness.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7541442: Coat removed
* !post #6933973: Coat on, with [[kamen rider 2 (shin)|No. 2]]

title: cross_(xenoblade_x)
body:
The customizable main character of [[Xenoblade Chronicles X]].

Contrary to popular belief, Cross is not the official name for the avatar. The avatar does not have a default name in Japanese, English, and other languages. The name "Cross" was used once in a Japanese footage from the Nintendo Direct aired on November 5, 2014. A fan translator mistook it as the official name for the avatar. This name was used again in the Japanese footage of the second trailer for Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition, while the name "Ryan" was used in the English footage.

The [[cross (male) (xenoblade_x)|default male]] has red-brown hair with a prominent cowlick, and the [[cross (female) (xenoblade x)|default female]] has black hair tied into medium twintails; however, unlike many comparably customizable protagonists, Cross's defaults are not particularly iconic, and most art of them is instead the artist's or commissioner's [[original]] character wearing in-game armor options.

title: cordelia_herschel_(young)_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Younger version of [[Cordelia herschel (mechanical buddy universe)|]]. Young mistress of an affluent household unravaged by the wars in the Mechanical Buddy Universe. Childhood 'friend' of the [[Shu (mechanical buddy universe)|]], and the one responsible for picking her up and pressing her into her service.

She is given the name "Cordelia Herschel" (コーディリア・ハーシェル) in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".

[spoiler]Posthumous character. The current [[Cordelia herschel (mechanical buddy universe)|]] is her robotic body double. In later chapters, proven to be the creator of [[Cordelia herschel (mechanical buddy universe)|]].[/spoiler]

title: suga_kenzo
body: A human researcher studying Granutes from [[Kamen Rider Gavv]]. He is secretly allied with the Stomach family's scientist, Nylev. Suga is responsible for creating the Valenbuster and performing the surgery on [[Karakida Hanto]] which allowed him to transform into [[Kamen Rider Valen]]. title: voices_of_the_void
body:

Visuals, physics and sound effects play homage to [[Valve Software|Valve's]] Source Engine, though the game itself is made with the [[Unreal Engine (medium)|]].

title: aladdin_(movie)
body:
[i]Aladdin[/i] is a 1992 animated film produced by [[Disney]], based on the Arab folktale [i]Aladdin and the Magic Lamp[/i] from [[arabian_nights|One Thousand and One Nights]]. The film's success led to a franchise that included two direct-to-video sequel films, a TV series, various video games (with Virgin Games' Sega Genesis/Mega Drive game and Capcom's Super Nintendo game both garnering praise among gamers), a few theme park attractions, and a Broadway musical.

title: astonaige_medoz
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] series. He first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] TV anime series from 1985. Also appears in the sequel TV series [[Gundam ZZ]] (1986) and the anime film [[Char's Counterattack]] (1988).

[b]Astoinage Medoz[/b] is the chief [[Mobile Suit]] mechanic of the AEUG [[Argama]] and [[Nahel Argama]]  [[military]] [[spacecraft]]. 

He later becomes part of the [[earth_federation_space_forces|Londo Bell fleet]] and the chief MS mechanic in the [[Ra Cailum]] spacecraft, where he starts a relationship with MS pilot [[Kayra Su]]. [spoiler]He died during the final battle of the Second [[Neo Zeon]] War when a stray [[Geara Doga]] [[beam rifle]] shot hit him while attending MS units at the ship's launch pad.[/spoiler]

body:

The film was heavily influenced by [[RoboCop]], released in the USA 3 years before.

title: third-party_edit
body:
An image that has been edited by someone other than the artist (a third party).

Third-party edits are generally against the [[help:upload rules|upload rules]] and should not be uploaded. This includes:

* [[nude filter]]s
* [[headshop]]s
* [[fake translation]]s
* [[third-party watermark]]s
* Fanmade meme or joke edits
* Removal of artist signatures or watermarks
* Anything else that substantially alters the content of the image

Minor edits that don't substantially alter the content of the image may be allowed under specific circumstances. This includes posts that have been [[stitched]], [[colorized]], [[cleaned]], [[detexted]] or slightly [[cropped]].

h4. See also
* [[Second-party edit]] - a second party (such as the [[commission]]er or anyone with the artist's permission) is involved in editing the image.
* [[Photoshop (medium)]] - apply this tag when Adobe Photoshop is actually used by the artist to create an image
* [[help:upload rules]]

title: zaku_ii_hmt_johnny_ridden_custom
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[MSV-R: The Return of Johnny Ridden]].

[b]MS-06R-2 Zaku II High Mobility Type (Johnny Ridden Custom)[/b]

An updated High Mobility Type for the [[Zaku II]] [[mobile suit]]. The R-2 had vastly more powerful foot thrusters compared to the preceding R-1 and R-1A, and was sometimes referred to as "a [[Gelgoog]] in Zaku's clothing." It was extremely hard to control, and therefore only the most skilled pilots, like the Crimson Lightning, [[Johnny Ridden]], could control the type. 

It didn't help that Ridden's unit was painted in bright red, which almost always resulted in him being mistaken for the Red Comet, [[Char Aznable]] - however, at closer inspection, Ridden's colors are a deeper shade of red with black accents and yellow shoulder spikes, and the feet have longer covers over the added thrusters.

title: zaku_mariner
body:
Fictional manned giant combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]RMS-192M Zaku Mariner[/b]

The [[Earth Federation]]'s production-line version of the Principality of [[Zeon]]'s MS-06M (MSM-01) [[Zaku Marine Type]] M-1 Prototype which was tested during [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]. 

Ironically, the EFF was never able to use these suits as they were captured by [[Neo Zeon]] during [[gundam_zz|The First Neo Zeon War]], when their forces invaded Earth in U.C. 0088. A team of Zaku Mariners were used on an attack on the [[Argama]] after the ship had descended to Earth.

In U.C. 0096, two Zaku Mariners were used by the Zeon Remnants during their [[gundam_unicorn|Attack on the Federation's Torrington Base]].

title: zssa
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in the [[Gundam ZZ]] TV series from 1986.

[b]AMX-102 Zssa[/b]

Small artillery type [[mobile_suit|MS]] created by [[Neo Zeon]]. As it was supposed to work in tandem with the close-quarters type [[Galluss-J]], it was loaded to the utter brim with [[missile]]s, guns and all sorts of extra ranged armament, serving as support. 

However, the Zssa was severely lacking in the melee combat area, so it required obligatory escort from raid capable [[mecha]] for each of its missions.

Not to be confused with [[one side up]], which also has hair tied on the side but it lets some hair fall loosely. In a [[side ponytail]] the majority of one's hair—save for [[sidelocks]]—is pulled up into a ponytail that leaves [b]no[/b] hair falling loosely.

title: donkey_kong_64
body:
The [[Donkey Kong_(series)|]] franchise's first 3D adventure platformer, released in 1999 on the [[Nintendo 64]]. 

The Kongs must race against time to stop [[King K. Rool]] from using his doomsday weapon, the Blast-o-Matic, from destroying DK Isles.

Along with [[Donkey Kong]] and [[Diddy Kong]] a new lineup of playable Kongs are added: [[Lanky Kong]], [[Tiny Kong]] and [[Chunky Kong]].

title: assassin_(fate/zero)
body:
The Servant of [[Kotomine Kirei]] in the 4th Holy Grail War. His unique trait is the capability to manifest as multiple entities at once.

The multiple bodies of Assassin can vary widely in [[child assassin (fate/zero)|age]], [[female assassin (fate/zero)|gender]], build, and style of dress, but in general, their hair appears purple, and their skin and clothing are nearly black. They wear the standard skull mask associated with the known Hassan of the other Grail Wars. Their unique sobriquet among the Hassan is "of the Hundred Faces".

Not to be mistaken with [[Sasaki Kojirou (fate)|Assassin (Fate/stay night)]].

[b]True Name:[/b] Hassan-i-Sabbah

title: takamiya_mio
body:
She is a character from [[Date a Live]] series.

As [[Takamiya Mana]]'s memories were starting to flash before her like a camera shutter, she managed to catch a glimpse of Mio's appearance, describing her as a girl with long hair. 

[spoiler]She is The First Spirit to make an appearance on 30 years before the beginning of the events in Date A Live, also known as the Spirit of Origin. She was summoned into the world by Sir Isaac Ray Pelham Westcott, [[Ellen Mira Mathers]], and Elliot Baldwin Woodman through the Spirit Formula gathering all the world's mana into a single point. However, her birth also caused the first spacequake in history at some point of the frontier between China and Mongolia, killing over 150 million people and starting a chain of similar disasters around the world that would last approximately six months.
[/spoiler]
[spoiler]It is revealed that Mio's doppelganger is [[Murasame Reine]].[/spoiler]

h4. External Links
* "Date A Live Wiki: Mio Takamiya":https://date-a-live.fandom.com/wiki/Mio_Takamiya

In [[Shingeki no Kyojin]], facial [[scar|scars]] appear on a [[Titan (Shingeki no Kyojin)|Titan]]-shifter's face, usually under their eyes, after reverting back to human form from a Titan transformation, or after using a Titan-shifter ability in human form. The users of the [[colossal titan]] have more extensive scars, both around the eyes and on the cheeks.

title: luke_sullivan
body:
A character from [[Street Fighter]] series, first debuted as the last DLC characters in [[Street Fighter V]] and serving as one of the main protagonist in [[Street Fighter 6]].

While he was still young, Luke lost his father Robert after the latter sacrifice himself in protecting civilians from terrorist attack. Inspired by his father's deeds, Luke joined the [[United States Army]] under [[Guile]]'s supervision. Feeling that military life is not fit for him, Luke resigned from the army and began his career as an PMC contractor and later an MMA coach.

A brash, hot-blooded, yet righteous character. Luke was designed to appeal the "new generation" of players by depicting him enjoying various hobby and modern culture, including playing video games. He is also depicted as a rival to the fellow hot-blooded fighter [[Jamie Siu]] since their childhood.

Luke's initial reception by fans were mixed-to-negative, as he was set up by [[Capcom]] to succeed [[Ryu (street fighter)|]] as the new leading cast of the franchise, though his popularity gradually improves, partly due to his English voice actor, Aleks Le, who has done various [[meme]] and shitposting video about him using his Luke character and often interact with the fanbase in various Luke-related tweets.

h5. Official bio

A contractor for a PMC, Luke uses his elite military background to teach mixed martial arts. His days off are spent eating junk food, playing PC video games, and fighting, but make no mistake—Luke plays to win.

* [b]Hates:[/b] Terrorism, horror games
* [b]Likes:[/b] Travelling, PC games, wacky T-shirts, his late father
* [b]Height:[/b] 185cm / 6'1 
* [b]Weight:[/b] 90kg / 198 lbs

title: ryu_(street_fighter)
body:
[i]You must defeat Sheng Long to stand a chance.[/i]
--Ryu, American version of [[Street Fighter II (series)|Street Fighter II]]
[tn]Mistranslation of the win quote, 昇龍拳を破らぬ限り、お前に勝ち目はない! ([i]lit.[/i] "If you cannot overcome the Shouryuuken, you don't stand a chance!) 
[/tn]

[b]Ryu[/b] is the main character and protagonist of the [[Street Fighter]] series. Ryu has made an appearance in every Street Fighter game, as well as in every crossover game with Capcom characters in it. Ryu has become a very famous character in the fighting genre, and is the star of the original Street Fighter.

As a very young child, Ryu was orphaned and left with no memories about his parents, and whether they were still alive. He was found and adopted by a man named [[Gouken]] who raised Ryu in his secluded dojo and trained Ryu in the ways of his martial arts. Shortly afterwards, Gouken would later train his best friend's spoiled son, [[Ken Masters]]. Ken served not only as a sparring partner, but also gave Ryu a friend in the form of a boy his own age.

Ryu looked up to Gouken as a father figure, and regards Ken as his best friend and surrogate brother, a relationship which remains to this day. When Ryu was 23 years old, Gouken believed that Ryu was ready to travel the world in order to test and hone his martial skills against the best fighters from around the world. With this, Ryu left Gouken's dojo, and headed to fight in the World Warrior tournament.

h4. Appearance

* !post #234921: [[Street Fighter II (series)|]]
* !post #7532479: [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|]]
* !post #1278526: [[Street Fighter III (series)|]]
* !post #309889: [[Street Fighter IV (series)|]]
* !post #2037003: [[Street Fighter V]]
* !post #6360628: [[Street Fighter 6]]

In most of his appearances, Ryu has [[short hair|short]] dark [[brown hair]] (sometimes depicted as [[black hair|black]] instead) tied with a [[red headband]]. He wears a white [[dougi]] with [[torn sleeves]] and red [[fingerless gloves]], and is usually [[barefoot]]. In his appearance in [i][[Street Fighter 6]][/i], he has grown a [[beard]] and forgone the upper portion of his dougi for a reddish-brown [[sash]].

h4. Known moves

* [[Hadouken]] (波動拳)
** Shakunetsu Hadouken (灼熱波動拳)
** Shinkuu Hadouken (真空波動拳)
** Denjin Hadouken (電刃波動拳)
** Metsu Hadouken (滅波動拳)

* [[Shouryuuken]] (昇龍拳)
** Shin Shouryuuken (真・昇龍拳)
** Metsu Shouryuuken (滅・昇龍拳)

* [[Tatsumaki Senpuukyaku]] (竜巻旋風脚)
** Shinkuu Tatsumaki Senpuukyaku (真空竜巻旋風脚)

h4. Alternate forms

* [[Evil Ryu]]
* [[Kagenarumono]]
* [[Crimson Hawk Ranger]]

title: evil_ryu
body:
[b]Evil Ryu[/b], whose full name is known as [b]Satsui no Hadou ni Mezameta Ryuu[/b] ([i]lit.[/i] "Ryu who has Awakened to the Surge of Killing Intent") or just [b]Satsui Ryu[/b] ([i]lit.[/i] "Murderous Ryu"), is a playable character in various [[Street Fighter]] games beginning with [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|Street Fighter Zero 2]]. He was originally introduced in a Street Fighter Zero manga series authored by [[Nakahira Masahiko]] and later adapted in the Street Fighter canon by [[Capcom]].

He is the version of [[Ryu (street fighter)|]] should he succumb to Satsui no Hadou, and depicts Ryu's struggle to resist the urge. Gameplay-wise, Evil Ryu has more powerful attacks than the original, strikes faster and possesses some of the attacks of [[Akuma (street fighter)|]]. The kanji 'Metsu' (滅) - meaning "destruction" - can be seen on his back when it appears after a Shun Goku Satsu finish.

h4. Known moves

* [[hadouken|Gou Hadouken]] (豪波動拳)
** Shakunetsu Hadouken (灼熱波動拳)
** Metsu Hadouken (滅波動拳)

* [[shouryuuken|Gou Shouryuuken]] (豪昇龍拳)
** Messatsu Gou Shouryuu (滅殺豪昇龍)

* Tatsumaki Senpuukyaku (竜巻旋風脚)

* Ryusokyaku

* Ashura Senku (阿修羅閃空)
** [[Shun Goku Satsu]] (瞬獄殺)

title: giant_of_light
body:
The species of [[giant]]s from the [[Ultra Series]], casually referred to as the [i]Ultra[/i] species, due to not having any official name. In lieu of that, they are often referred to as [i]Giants of Light[/i] in official media. They are sometimes also referred to as the [i]Residents of the [[Land of Light]][/i] (or Light-lander), or [i]Residents of the M78 Nebula[/i], but this can be ambiguous as the Ultras are not the only species there, and they can be found residing in other lands/nebulas/universes (ex. the Ultra People of Planet U40).

This tag is intended for depictions of Giants of Light that aren't any of the official Ultra characters, whether it be ersatz characters just referencing the series, or [[original]] Ultra characters.

They are depicted with skin that feature either silver, red or blue as their dominant color, and then either of the remaining two along with black or more as highlights, with their dominant color representing to which subspecies among the Ultra species they belong to. Every Giant's body bears unique markings/patterns and features which enables them to be distinguished from one another (this includes the various generic unique designs made for depicting the Light-landers, though some depictions have generic Ultras depicted as looking basically like [[Ultraman]]).

h4. External links

* Ultraman Wiki: "Residents of the Land of Light":[https://ultra.fandom.com/wiki/Residents_of_the_Land_of_Light]
other_names: オリジナルウルトラマン

title: cardcaptor_sakura_clear_card_arc
body:
The sequel to [[Cardcaptor Sakura]], written and illustrated by the manga group [[Clamp (circle)|]]. It focuses on [[Kinomoto Sakura]] in junior high school. The manga was serialized in Kodansha's Nakayoshi magazine between the July 2016 and January 2024 issues, with the chapters being collected in 16 volumes. A 22-episode anime television series adaptation produced by Madhouse, featuring the cast and staff from the original series, aired from January to June 2018, which loosely adapts the first 24 chapters.

Use this tag when the fanart has [[Yume no Tsue]], [[Shinomoto Akiho]],  [[Yuna D Kaito]] or [[Tomoeda middle school uniform]].

title: ayunda_risu_(cyberpunk)
body:
The 4th/[[Cyberpunk]] [[official alternate costume|costume]] for [[hololive Indonesia|hololive ID]]'s [[Ayunda Risu]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/8103x/status/1585053541403889664].

It consists of a [[two-tone jacket|two tone]] and [[black jacket]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[pink sleeves|pink]] [[raglan sleeves]] anda [[popped collar]], a [[black_shirt|black]] [[crop top|black crop]], [[chest harness]] with an [[underbust]] [[chest belt]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] a [[black pantyhose]] a [[thigh strap]] on left left leg and black [[leg ribbon|ribbon]] wrapped around her lower right leg and [[pink shoes|pink]] [[sneakers]]. She also has an optional [[pink-tinted eyewear|pink-tinted]] [[head-mounted display]] and a [[headset]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume is [[short hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] [[colored inner hair]] and [[streaked hair|streaks]]/[[colored tips]] decorated with a bateri charge indicator-shaped [[hairclip]] on one side and an [[x hair ornament|x-shaped]] one on the other.

title: houshou_marine_(nun)
body:
An [[alternate costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Houshou Marine]]. Originated from a fanart by [[Oshiruko (oshiruco 212048)|]] posted on the end of October 2021, which was later used by Marine herself for the use in her "sin confessions" stream. A [[revealing clothes|skimpy]] version of the costume also briefly appeared in her first confession stream.

The costume consists of a dark blue [[nun]] habit with white double triangular [[breast curtain]]s and a dark blue [[pelvic curtain]]. There are two "skimpy" versions of the outfit, one with the inner garments removed (including [[no bra|bra]] and [[no panties|panties]]) revealing the wearer's [[underboob]] and only has the aforementioned curtains to cover their private parts. The other "skimpy" version swaps the long pelvic curtain for an even shorter one covering the crotch, leaving the [[midriff]] exposed. On December 2022, a revised version of the original costume was revealed. This version of the costume differs by using the same hairstyle of her [[houshou marine (marching band)|band costume]] and the addition of a suggestive [[underboob cutout]] on the costume.
 
While this costume is technically unofficial (as it never received an official model for obvious reasons), it has gained notoriety within and out of the Hololive fanbase for its frequent usage by Marine herself, which resulted in it gaining the status of a [[meme attire]].

This tag is applicable to any posts that:
* Features Marine herself wearing any variant of the outfit or derivative of it, and not a generic [[nun]] outfit.
* Has other character(s) wearing any variant of the outfit or derivative of it. In this case, the tag [[Houshou Marine (cosplay)]] is applicable.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4880115: 1st version (normal)
* !post #4880121: 1st version (skimpy variant 1)
* !post #4882536: 1st version (skimpy variant 2)
* !post #5924061: 2nd version

h4. See also

* [[Houshou Marine (Ahoy!! You're All Pirates)|Ahoy!! You're All Pirates]] - an official costume using nun elements

title: impa
body:
A female recurring character in [[The Legend of Zelda]] series. She is a descendant of the mysterious [[Sheikah]] tribe that has served the Royal Family of Hyrule for many generations, and is [[Princess Zelda]]'s personal attendant. She often aids Link in his quest by giving him useful information. Her depiction in each game has varied widely; from a withered old woman, to large, middle aged woman, to a lithe, young bodyguard.

In [[the_legend_of_zelda:_ocarina_of_time|Ocarina of Time]] and [[the_legend_of_zelda:_a_link_between_worlds|A Link Between Worlds]], she is the Sage of Shadows.

She returns as a playable character in the spin-off title [[Hyrule Warriors]], where she fights using a giant [[sword|blade]] and a [[naginata]]. Ironically, she is initially suspicious of [[Sheik]].

The Impa in [[Hyrule Warriors: Age Of Calamity]] is the exact same Impa as the one in [[the_legend_of_zelda:_breath_of_the_wild|Breath Of The Wild]], except a hundred years [[aged down|younger]]. This Impa is much closer to [[paya_(zelda)|Paya]], her future granddaughter, than to any previous versions of Impa, and [[look-alike|not just in looks]].

title: standard_8_(mario)
body: A specific variant of the classic [[standard kart (mario)|Standard Kart]] design that originally appeared in [[Mario Kart 8]] and later re‐imagined as a distinct vehicle in [[Mario Kart Tour]]. In its original form in Mario Kart 8 (and its updated port, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe), the Standard Kart is the basic, well‐balanced racing vehicle that every racer can use without offering any particular advantages or drawbacks. Over time, however, this familiar design was reworked for other titles in the [[Mario Kart]] franchise.

title: purah
body:
Character in [i][[The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild]][/i]. A Sheikah researcher and [[Impa]]'s elder sister. Despite being over a century old, she appears as a 6-year-old child due to an age-reversing experiment.

In the prequel [i][[Hyrule Warriors: Age Of Calamity]][/i], she is (apparently and actually) in her 20s.

In the sequel [i][[The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom]][/i], she again appears to be in her 20s like in [i]Age of Calamity[/i], but with a different outfit.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25480770: Breath of the Wild ([[Purah (Young)|Young]])
* !post #4161538: Hyrule Warriors: Age Of Calamity
* !post #6399640: Tears of the Kingdom

title: ganaha_hibiki
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series, introduced in the PSP game [i]Idolmaster SP[/i]. Hibiki became an idol in order to make everyone happy, and while competitive against the idols of [i]765[/i], she remains friendly, never becoming over-competitive. She is frequently pictured with her pets, most notably her hamster [[Hamuzou]] and dog [[Inumi]].

Hibiki is an idol from 961 Production's "Project Fairy", along with ex-[i]765[/i] idol [[Hoshii Miki]] and [[Shijou Takane]].

Voiced by [[Numakura Manami]].

* !asset #25478402: [[Idolmaster One for All|One for All]]
* !asset #25478453: [[Idolmaster Platinum Stars|Platinum Stars]] / [[Idolmaster Stella Stage|Stella Stage]] / [[Idolmaster Starlit Season|Starlit Season]]
* !asset #25478403: [[Idolmaster Million Live! Theater Days|Theater Days]]

h4. External links

* "Idolmaster Wiki: Hibiki Ganaha":http://www.project-imas.wiki/Hibiki_Ganaha

title: shijou_takane
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series, introduced in the PSP game [i]Idolmaster SP[/i].  While hailing from a wealthy family, Takane is a polyglot, has a passion for music, and although haughty, is very polite even to her rivals from [i]765[/i].

Takane is an idol from 961 Production's "Project Fairy" along with ex-[i]765[/i] idol [[Hoshii Miki]] and [[Ganaha Hibiki]].

Voiced by [[Hara Yumi]].

title: voice_actor_connection
body:
A [[crossover]], [[cosplay]] or [[parody]] based on a character's [[voice actor]].

Most often, this is a character [[cosplay]]ing another character played by the same actor, or a [[crossover]] between multiple characters played by the same actor.

Other examples include:

* A character drawn with their voice actor.
* A voice actor cosplaying their own character.
* A character using mannerisms of their voice actor, or another character played by the same actor.
* A [[crossover]] between two characters played by related voice actors (by family or by marriage).
* A [[crossover]] between [[virtual youtuber]]s played by the same person.

When tagging the voice actor connection, please also tag the name of the [[voice actor]] referred to by the connection. Only include the [[voice actor]] tag if the actor him/herself is physically present in the image, or a character is cosplaying as the actor.

This tag applies best on characters from different series but can be used for character from the same series as long as the designs aren't intentionally made similar for [[uniform]] or [[matching outfits]] purposes.

title: object_namesake
body:
A type of [[pun]] when a character is paired with any kind of object or animal that makes a reference to their civilian or alter ego's name. For instance, 'Yuri/百合' means '[[lily (flower)|lily]]', so a character named Yuri holding a bouquet of lilies would qualify.

h4. Examples

* any character named Ringo and an [[apple]] ("ringo" means apple)
* any character named Sakura and [[cherry blossoms]] ("sakura" means cherry blossom)
* [[Ibuki Suika]] and a [[watermelon]] or [[watermelon bar]] ("suika" means watermelon)
* [[Patchouli Knowledge]] and a [[patchouli_(plant)|patchouli]]
* any character named Raven and a black bird
* [[Tsubaki Yayoi]] and a [[camellia]] ("tsubaki" means camellia)
* [[BlazBlue]]'s [[Bullet (BlazBlue)|Bullet]] with an ammunition [[bullet]]
* any [[personification]] of an object depicted with the non-personified version of that object

title: hoshii_miki
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series, introduced in the Xbox 360 version of the original [i]Idolmaster[/i] game.
A dyed-blonde 14-year-old idol from 961 Production's "Project Fairy" along with [[Ganaha Hibiki]] and [[Shijou Takane]], having defected from 765 Production (as of the DS game [i]Dearly Stars[/i]) due to her dissatisfaction with her handling. It is shown that Miki joins 765 Production, along with Hibiki and Takane, in the Idolmaster anime. Laid-back but brilliant, Miki is very popular with males, and believes in an easy way to becoming the top idol.

* !asset #25478293: [[Idolmaster 1]] / [[Idolmaster Live for You!|Live for You!]]
* !asset #25478315: [[Idolmaster SP]]
* !asset #25478397: [[Idolmaster One for All|One for All]]
* !asset #25478470: [[Idolmaster Platinum Stars|Platinum Stars]] / [[Idolmaster Stella Stage|Stella Stage]] / [[Idolmaster Starlit Season|Starlit Season]]
* !asset #25478433: [[Idolmaster Million Live! Theater Days|Theater Days]]

h4. Stats 

* Birthday: November 23
* Horoscope: Sagittarius ♐
* Age: 14 → 15
* Height: 159cm → 161cm 
* Weight: 44kg → 45kg 
* BMI: 17.4 → 17.3
* Measurements: 84-55-82 → 86-55-83 
* Cup size: F
* Blood Type: B

title: minase_iori
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series, Iori is the daughter of a CEO acquainted with 765 Production's president. Polite and refined to the audience, but sharp-tongued towards her fellow idols and Producer. Frequently found with her stuffed rabbit Usa-chan.

Not to be confused with the seiyuu [[Minase Inori]].

Voiced by [[Kugimiya Rie]].

body:

Her cousin [[akizuki ryo|Ryo]] appears in the DS game [i]Dearly Stars[/i] as an idol of 876 Production (and later in Side-M).

She has [[brown eyes]], wears [[glasses]], and her [[brown hair]] is often tied into [[twin braids]].

title: spider-man
body:
[b]Spider-Man[/b] is a fictional [[marvel|Marvel Comics]] superhero. The character was created by writer-editor [[Stan Lee]] and writer-artist Steve Ditko. He first appeared in [i]Amazing Fantasy[/i] #15 (Aug. 1962).

[[Peter Parker]] was orphaned at the age of six when his parents were killed in an airplane crash overseas. He went to live with his uncle and aunt; Ben and May Parker, in Forest Hills, [[New York City]]. Parker was extremely bright and became a high honors student at Midtown High School. Parker's shyness and scholastic interest often made him a social outcast. 

While attending a public exhibition demonstrating the safe handling of nuclear laboratory waste materials sponsored by the General Techtronics Corporation, Peter was bitten by a spider which had been irradiated by a particle accelerator used in the demonstration. Making his way home afterwards, Peter discovered he had somehow gained incredible strength, agility, and the ability to cling to walls; spider-like traits that he immediately associated with the spider bite. 

In the 1970s, he was given his own [[tokusatsu]] [[spider-man (toei)|series]] in Japan where he had a [[mecha]] ([[Leopardon]]).

On [[Nijiura]], he shares a flat with [[Astaroth (Shinrabanshou)]], [[WE-tan]], and [[Yamada-san]].

body:

She has [[green eyes]] and [[very long hair|very]] [[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[purple hair]] with [[side braids]] on both sides and [[blunt bangs]].

In the second season, she typically wears a uniform very similar to the [[Mizukawa school uniform]], only with a [[black necktie]], a [[red sweater vest]], and no emblem. In the third season, she wears the standard [[Yuigaoka school uniform]].

Voiced by [[Yuina (voice actor)|]].

title: igaa
body:
Light [[Inbit]] [[alien]] aerospace [[mecha]] from the [[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada]] 80s anime series. 

The Inbit [b]Igaa[/b] is a red mecha that is faster and more maneuverable than the [[Gurab]], but is smaller, weaker and has less powerful energy weaponry. The combat Igaa has two rapid fire energy cannons while the recon version has none.

They are usually deployed in very vast numbers (swarms). The Igaa are designed for both air and space combat.
